Jogabilidade, hist√≥ria e gr√°ficos 10/10, do caralh*!

Eu preciso do pr√≥ximo, agora :c

F

Well, I will admit, I don't have many hours playing this, and that's because back in 2007 I was deployed to Iraq and had limited time to play. But from what I did play, game was awesome. I did play and beat ep1, and moved on to this. I beat the OG Half-life back in 98. The Half Life games and what changed the way games are today. Absolutely awesome games. It's a shame it was just Left 4 Dead ( pun intended ). They were going to be 7 ep's, But like all Valve's hits, they just abandon it.
Best installment of [i]Half-Life 2[/i] right here. Big step up from the previous episode. I also want to thank Valve for finally doing something about that cliffhanger after nearly 13 years.
The entire Half Life series is bangin'
Neighborhood Watch has driven me to the brink of insanity. 10/10
I really recommend this game!! The amount of time the devs put into this game is crazy!! Like, holy! The graphics are very good and the game play is also great!
Has aged beautifully since release. Textures look a bit dated but gameplay, sound design, and story are still great. Now the wait begins for HL3
Awesome action and game play ending causing lots of frustration

Half-life 3'√º √ßƒ±karƒ±n karde≈üim, kuruduk burda.
Son g√∂revin √ßok iyi olduƒüunu da s√∂ylemek gerek.

Bienvenido de nuevo Dr. Freeman:

El Episodio Uno continuaba la historia inmediatamente despu√©s del fin de HL2. Nuestro objetivo principal era volver a Ciudad 17 para estabilizar el reactor o n√∫cleo principal de la ciudadela y as√≠ ganar un tiempo precioso que nos permitiese alejarnos lo suficiente de √©sta antes de su inevitable explosi√≥n ‚Äìhechos que se nos resumir√°n brevemente al comienzo de esta nueva expasi√≥n mediante un video-. Ahora en el Episodio Dos deberemos llegar a una base de la resistencia llamada White Forest atravesando un extens√≠simo bosque, previa visita "guiada" a una colmena de hormigas le√≥n. En esta trepidante aventura estaremos de nuevo acompa√±ado gran parte del tiempo por nuestra inseparable compa√±era Alyx Vance, siendo esta vez clave en el devenir de la historia (con la inevitable aparici√≥n de G-man incluida). La idea de desarrollar tres expansiones (llamadas obviamente Episode One, Two y Three) que complementaran a Half-Life 2 ten√≠an un doble objetivo: por un lado, desarrollar a√∫n m√°s toda la historia tras lo sucedido en HL2 y de paso, enriquecer todo lo que rodea a este gran universo de ciencia-ficci√≥n que es Half-Life; y por otro lado, hacer m√°s corta la espera para la siguiente entrega, Half-Life 3. A la vista de los largos, casi eternos, desarrollos de la compa√±√≠a americana, nos parece sin duda una idea excelente.
Motor Source vitaminado
Pese a que ya tenemos en ciernes nuevos motores gr√°ficos realmente brutos como el Unreal Engine 3 (Bioshock, Gears of War, Unreal, Tournament III‚Ä¶) y sobre todo, el Crytek Engine 2 desarrollado para el todopoderoso Crysis que sale el mes que viene; el que desarroll√≥ Valve para Half-Life 2, llamado Source sigue manteniendo el tipo m√°s que decentemente tres a√±os despu√©s de su salida. Ello es posible gracias a que es bastante escalable y paulatinamente se le han ido a√±adiendo efectos tales como HDR (alto rango din√°mico) y ya en este Ep2, mejores efectos de luces, part√≠culas y texturas, sombreado din√°mico y Phong Shading (una variante del Vertex Shading con resultados incre√≠bles en el suavizado de texturas como podremos apreciar en el Vortigaunt que nos ayuda). Tambi√©n se ha mejorado sustancialmente la f√≠sica del juego (veremos alg√∫n derrumbe espectacular) y las expresiones faciales de los personajes, mostrando en conjunto un apartado gr√°fico poco sorprendente a estas alturas pero si muy bueno.

Un c√≥ctel perfecto:

Pese a que gr√°ficamente luce a un gran nivel, el aut√©ntico punto fuerte de la saga siempre radic√≥ en su exquisita jugabilidad. Una combinaci√≥n magistral de aventura en forma de exploraci√≥n e ingeniosos puzzles unidos a brillantes momentos de acci√≥n. La perfecta curva de dificultad y el gran dise√±o de niveles hacen el resto. Una verdadera maravilla de los videojuegos. Episodio 2 no iba a ser menos y adem√°s no da un s√≥lo momento de respiro. Tan pronto estamos dentro de oscuros e intrincados t√∫neles iluminados s√≥lo por larvas de hormigas le√≥n para poco despu√©s enfrentarnos a tres raptores (una de las novedades de esta entrega en forma de "hermanos peque√±os" de los zancudos) en mitad de un bosque o recorremos largos trayectos rurales en un destartalado veh√≠culo. El motor Havok de f√≠sicas tambi√©n ayuda bastante proporcion√°ndonos algunos rompecabezas realmente buenos con menci√≥n especial para el del puente semi-derruido. Tampoco pod√≠an faltar peque√±as partes de plataformeo, alg√∫n que otro susto con los zombies y una interacci√≥n con los personajes no jugables sensacional.

Las partes de acci√≥n siguen siendo muy espectaculares e ir√°n "in crescendo" hasta la antol√≥gica batalla final en White Forest donde se alcanza una emoci√≥n y dinamismo pocas veces vista en un videojuego (en serio, merece la pena disfrutar esa parte porque es incre√≠ble). Tampoco se queda atr√°s la impactante escena final justo despu√©s de la batalla y los hechos que ocurren, preludio claro del pr√≥ximo episodio.

Conclusi√≥n:

Al igual que ocurr√≠a con el anterior episodio, es inevitable plantearse si merece la pena adquirir esta expansi√≥n por s√≠ sola -el pack Orange Box es un verdadero regalo por Steam, teniendo en cuenta todo lo que trae-. Centr√°ndonos en el juego que nos ocupa, Half-Life: Episode Two da para seis, siete horas como mucho si se hace pausadamente y explorando todo en modo de dificultad Normal. Eso si, son seis horas verdaderamente absorbentes con momentos realmente tremendos que pocos videojuegos del g√©nero llega a alcanzar. Personalmente opino que este episodio supera con creces al anterior. Adem√°s, esta vez han tenido la ingeniosa idea de incluir una serie de logros ‚Äìcomo matar un raptor con sus propios proyectiles o encontrar todas las balizas del camino-.
Better than half life 2 episode 1. Great ending that to this day, hasn't been explained.

This builds on Half-Life 2 and E1 so much. Some of the improvements are the flashlight is separate from the rest of the power, new creatures ([spoiler]the ant lion grub, and the ant lion worker[/spoiler]), and they also polished the visuals. [b]10/10[/b]
The game is awesome! the graphics and physics are better this time. A nice continue of Half-Life. The only thing I hate is the white flash when you get hit.

Now where is the next one??

The best Half Life game by several hundred miles. I nstead of being a drab, cramped, miserable, greyish and predictable corridor shooter, HLE2 is actually quite beautiful, very varied and quite interesting. Very similar to the first Halo game, with its expansive maps and gorgeous scenery.

It's also the only HL game I was motivated to replay.

It's a great add-on to the original, even better than Part 1 in many respects! Here's hoping for Episode 3, I suppose.
very fun definitely the best half life game ever
I loved this game on The Orange Box on Xbox 360. Honestly about as good as Half-Life 2 itself. Love it.

This is my favorite Half Life game. Episode one was pretty good, And The Base Game was Really Great But this one is just right for me. The Difficulty is a bit harder than half life 2 without being to hard. The game is short and sweet just like episode 1 and The gameplay is just as perfect as it has been. It's unfortunate that the Game ends on a cliffhanger and the story only progressed 10 seconds with the end credits scene of Half Life Alyx. But I am honored to give this game my very first 8/8.

Dejen de ser avaros y saquen ya el episodio 3

I recommend this game because I enjoyed it. Do I feel any better for playing it? No. And what I am about to say goes for the whole Half Life 2 Trilogy. I never understood people being genuinely distraught by the lack of a third part because I have never had any attachment to this franchise. But now I kinda wish I hadn't played it. Call me a little bitch, ok, but I have been going through a [b] three [/b] day-long depressive [b] episode [/b] because I may just never know what happened after [spoiler] Eli dies [/spoiler]. This game gives, then takes away. A tragic masterpiece. [i] (I am aware of HL: Alyx, but VR is expensive as balls and I've heard it doesn't advance the story that much anyways.) [/i]

Half-Life 2: Episode Two is a continuation to Half-Life 2: Episode One.

Pros:
- Same graphics as Half-Life 2
- The forest setting is really good
- The story still continues to be strong
- Same characters, and newer characters you meet throghout the story
- Newer enemies
- A newer vehicle with great handling and sounds
- Very good physics
- Interesting puzzles
- Maps are really good
- Great soundtrack
- Great voice acting
- Gun handling is good

Cons:
- Biggest Cliffhanger in gaming history
- We didn't get any newer Half-Life game to continue this story since 2007

10/10 it's just more Half-Life, but you will be disappointed that there is no Half-Life 3

some how i never finished this chapter of the story. even more idiotically i have studied this abandoned game and it story, lore, and universe. after all Mr.Freeman had shown me the tender ways of FPS gameplay in my youth, surely he would deliver his strong silent affection again.

but me being hopeful that this short little game would hold some secret the internet has not already put to light but it had not. all my unanswered question now joined the brotherhood of confusion that seeped into the internet, ignored by valve.

Mr.Freeman did not give a satisfied ending. sad.

well i would still play again at some point only to relive the let down.

38.2 hrs on record (21.0 hrs at review time)
POSTED: 8 AUGUST
This game is a classic that will be hard to beat for many years to come. Whilst the graphics are not up to x box level, the game play and interaction is totally immersive. A.I. is unsurpassed and it is not surprising that the game was voted 5 years on the trot. Some parts of the game can be very infuriating, but that is true of most games, and a trip to You-tube for hints is sometimes the only explanation you will need to evade capture. overall I would give this game and its spin offs 11 out of 10. However, and this is not the place to mention it, but, Black Mesa is far too dark to be encouraging or playable. See my review.
